entry.title: Combined summary - Bip 32 Question
entry.summary: James Poole is seeking clarification on the role of "n" in the BIP32 algorithm. Specifically, he is referring to the step "The returned child key ki is parse256(IL) + kpar (mod n)" in the section "Private parent key â†’ private child key." Through a discussion about BIP32, it was found that "n" represents the curve order and its purpose is to keep the user on the curve. The function secp256k1_ec_privkey_tweak_add from libsecp256k1 automatically handles this step, but it may need to be done manually if OpenSSL or some non-EC math library is used. James has provided a link to the BIP32 definition for reference.
